qas.question: What was the first BeiDou system called?

answers.text: the BeiDou Satellite Navigation Experimental System

qas.question: Who does the BeiDou-1 operate for?

answers.text: mainly for customers in China and neighboring regions

qas.question: What is another name for the BeiDou Satellite Navigation Experimental System?
How many satellites does the BeiDou-1 have?
How long has the BeiDou-1 been operating?
Which system has been offering services to customers in China since 1997?

plausible_answers.text: the BeiDou Satellite Navigation Experimental System

qas.question: What system is also known as BeiDou-2?
BeiDou-1 consists of 7 satellites and offers what?
What system offers services to customers in and around Peru?

context: The first <b5_0>BeiDou<b5_0/> system, officially called <a0_0><b6_0>the BeiDou Satellite Navigation Experimental System<b6_0/><a0_0/> (simplified Chinese: 北斗卫星导航试验系统; traditional Chinese: 北斗衛星導航試驗系統; pinyin: Běidǒu wèixīng dǎoháng shìyàn xìtǒng) and also known as <a2_0><b8_0>BeiDou-1<b8_0/><a2_0/>, consists of <a3_0>three<a3_0/> satellites and offers <b7_0>limited coverage and applications.<b7_0/> It has been offering navigation services, <a1_0>mainly for customers in China and neighboring regions<a1_0/>, <a4_0>since 2000<a4_0/>.
